source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Spikelet less than 7 mm long; sterile lemmas obtuse or somewhat acute (sometimes shortly mucronate)
Spikelet 7 mm long or more; at least the upper sterile lemmas acute to acuminate
Leaves flat or incurved; stems and leaves scabrous or hairy
Leaves tightly involute; stems and leaves smooth and glabrous
Leaves distichous, often rather crowded, usually hairy; stems not strongly scabrous; spikelets hairy
Leaves not obviously distichous, often distant; stems and leaves usually coarsely scabrous; spikelets glabrous
